Pre-Game Insights: In their final group stage match of the T20 World Cup, hosts West Indies will face Afghanistan in Gros Islet. Both teams aim to build momentum for the Super Eights at the Daren Sammy National Stadium in Saint Lucia.
Following a spirited victory over Papua New Guinea, the West Indies are gradually settling into a routine. New Zealand and Uganda were dismissed.
Afghanistan, however, has thus far had a perfect campaign.
The Caribbean pitches are providing favorable circumstances for Rashid Khan and company.
The only thing on the line in the last Group C matchup-both teams having advanced to the Super Eights-is momentum.
West Indies skipper Rovman Powell emphasized the importance of maintaining momentum and playing consistent cricket going into the Super Eights.
Afghanistan head coach Jonathan Trott mentioned that the team is focused on achieving things that no other Afghanistan team has done before and is not looking too far ahead.
The pitch at the Darren Sammy National Stadium is among the greatest in the USA and the Caribbean, with high-scoring games expected.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mujeeb Ur Rahman, an off-spinner for Afghanistan, will not be playing in the competition because of a finger injury.
The conditions will be welcomed by the colorful West Indies hitters who are looking to score some huge runs.
West Indies skipper Rovman Powell acknowledged that the home hitters had not yet established a rhythm but saw the upcoming match as an opportunity to get it right on a better wicket.
